alert.note: Alert for Cass; Menard; Sangamon (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 7:14PM CDT until August 29 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Menard County in central Illinois... Northwestern Sangamon County in central Illinois... Southeastern Cass County in west central Illinois... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Chatham, Sherman, Riverton, Ashland, Pleasant Plains, Tallula, Jerome, Southern View, Leland Grove, Grandview, Clear Lake, Curran, Farmingdale, Salisbury and Capital Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
